title: Jaguars not making Chip Kelly OC, retaining Nathaniel Hackett instead

text:
Jaguars not making Chip Kelly OC, retaining Nathaniel Hackett instead The Jacksonville Jaguars have their  , and it’s not Chip Kelly. Post to Facebook Jaguars not making Chip Kelly OC, retaining Nathaniel Hackett instead The Jacksonville Jaguars have their  , and it’s not Chip Kelly.  //usat.ly/2jAAtyW   1 To   Jaguars not making Chip Kelly OC, retaining Nathaniel Hackett instead Tom Pelissero , USA TODAY Sports 6:34   CLOSE x Share USA Today Sports' Lorenzo Reyes makes his picks for this weekend's AFC and NFC Championship games. USA TODAY Sports San Francisco 49ers head coach Chip Kelly looks on during the fourth quarter against the Seattle Seahawks at Levi's Stadium. (Photo: Kyle Terada, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Jacksonville Jaguars have their  , and it’s not Chip Kelly. 
The team announced Wednesday it is retaining Nathaniel Hackett, who replaced Greg Olson in the role on an interim basis midway through this past season under former coach Gus Bradley. 
The announcement comes two days after Kelly was in the Jaguars’ building, presumably to discuss the coordinator role. ESPN has reported the Jaguars also interviewed him for their head coaching job before deciding to promote Doug Marrone from interim coach instead. 
Hackett, 37, previously served as OC under Marrone at Syracuse and with the Buffalo Bills. 
Despite a 3-13 finish, the Jaguars opted to stay in-house for their head coach (Marrone),   (Hackett) and defensive coordinator (Todd Wash). They did change up the organization’s power structure, hiring Tom Coughlin to oversee football operations. 
So, Kelly’s comeback apparently will have to happen someplace else. The San Francisco 49ers fired him as head coach Jan. 1, hours completing a 2-14 season, and a little over a year after the Philadelphia Eagles fired Kelly late in his third season there. 
Follow Tom Pelissero on Twitter @TomPelissero .
